intro: Dialium acuminatum, commonly known as the African plum or yellow-wood, is a medium-sized deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
